vibiom.name: Vibiom
vibiom.description: Vibiom MVP is a multi-agent AI orchestrator that coordinates 3 specialized agents (Product, Backend, Security) to build production-grade software from specifications. Proves that coordinated AI specialists produce better code than single-agent systems.
vibiom.problem: Solo developers want to build ambitious products but can't afford full engineering organizations. Existing AI coding tools help write code faster, but they're single-agent assistants—you still do all the architecture, security review, testing, and coordination yourself.
vibiom.solution: Vibiom MVP coordinates 3 specialized agents: Product (specs), Backend (implementation), Security (review). Each agent specializes in one domain, validates previous work, and hands off through structured workflows.
target_audience: Solo developers wanting to build complex products
Small startups needing rapid prototyping
Freelance developers scaling output
vibiom.mission_statement: Prove that coordinated AI specialists build better software than single AI generalists.
vibiom.success_milestone: Successfully orchestrate 3 agents to build a complete backend API from a specification

tempered-ui.name: TemperedUI
tempered-ui.description: TemperedUI is a security-first React component library that makes secure development effortless and fast. It provides beautiful, accessible components with built-in protection against XSS, CSRF, and injection attacks. Features include auto-sanitizing inputs, secure forms with automatic token management, and safe links that prevent tabnabbing—all styled with Tailwind CSS.
tempered-ui.problem: Building secure web applications requires developers to manually implement protection against XSS, CSRF, injection attacks, and other vulnerabilities for every input, form, and link. Security code is repetitive, easy to forget, and constantly needs updating as new attack vectors emerge.
tempered-ui.solution: TemperedUI is a React component library where security is built into every component by default. Inputs auto-sanitize, forms include CSRF token management, links prevent tabnabbing, and all components are designed by an application security professional.
target_audience: Full-stack developers building web applications who want secure components out-of-the-box
Frontend developers needing accessible, well-designed UI components with built-in security
Startups and small teams looking to ship secure applications faster without dedicated security experts
Freelance developers wanting to ensure their applications are secure without extra effort
tempered-ui.mission_statement: TemperedUI exists because security should never be an afterthought developers bolt on manually. Our mission is to make secure development the default path by building React components where protection is built into the foundation.
tempered-ui.success_milestone: TemperedUI is used in 3 production projects (internal or external) and prevents at least one documented security vulnerability
tempered-ui.tagline: Beautiful components that protect by default. Ship secure apps without writing security code.

mindtrace.name: MindTrace
mindtrace.description: MindTrace is a fast, focused web application designed for teachers, therapists, and school counselors to log student behavioral incidents in under 30 seconds. Users select a student, choose the behavior type and mood, mark incidents as aggressive or sensory-related, and add contextual notes—then save.
mindtrace.problem: Teachers, therapists, and school counselors need to document student behavioral incidents quickly and accurately, but existing solutions are either too slow (paper notes that get lost), too clunky (spreadsheets), or too complex (enterprise software designed for administrators, not frontline educators).
mindtrace.solution: MindTrace is built specifically for busy educators who need rapid documentation and easy access to behavioral data. Log an incident in under 30 seconds: select student, choose behavior type and mood, mark if aggressive or sensory-related, add notes, save.
target_audience: Teachers managing classroom behavior documentation
School counselors tracking student behavioral patterns
Therapists working with children who need incident logging
Special education coordinators preparing IEP documentation
mindtrace.mission_statement: MindTrace exists because educators deserve tools as fast as they need to be. Our mission is to give teachers, counselors, and therapists back their time by making behavioral documentation instant and effortless.
mindtrace.success_milestone: 5 teachers or counselors use MindTrace for 30 days and report it saves them time compared to their previous system
mindtrace.tagline: Log student behavior in 30 seconds. Simple, fast, and built for educators who don't have time to waste.

devgauntlet.name: DevGauntlet
devgauntlet.description: DevGauntlet is a comprehensive professional software engineering training platform where developers build real projects by completing Jira-style tickets—no tutorials, just requirements and automated testing. Starting with backend development (authentication, APIs, databases), DevGauntlet expands across the entire engineering stack.
devgauntlet.problem: Most developer education focuses on tutorials that hold your hand through every step, leaving developers unprepared for real work where you get a ticket, research solutions, and ship tested code. Junior developers struggle to prove they can work independently because they've never practiced taking requirements and delivering working software.
devgauntlet.solution: DevGauntlet teaches professional development by having you do professional development. You receive Jira-style tickets with requirements and acceptance criteria. You research, implement, and test your solution. Automated testing validates your work.
target_audience: Self-taught developers wanting to learn professional workflows
Bootcamp graduates needing to prove they can work independently
Junior developers preparing for their first engineering role
Career changers building a portfolio of real project work
devgauntlet.mission_statement: DevGauntlet exists because tutorials don't prepare you for real work. Our mission is to train developers the way they'll actually work—by taking tickets, researching solutions, writing tested code, and shipping.
devgauntlet.success_milestone: 15 developers sign up and complete at least one full backend project challenge (MVP phase)
devgauntlet.tagline: No tutorials. Just challenges. Build like a professional developer, not a student.

scopecreep.name: ScopeCreep
scopecreep.description: ScopeCreep is an automated testing platform for PostgreSQL Row-Level Security (RLS) policies. Similar to APIsec's approach for API security testing, ScopeCreep continuously validates that database access controls work as intended by testing RLS policies against realistic user scenarios.
scopecreep.problem: Row-Level Security in PostgreSQL is powerful but notoriously difficult to test correctly. Developers define RLS policies assuming they work, but misconfigurations often go undetected until a data breach occurs. Manual testing is tedious and incomplete.
scopecreep.solution: ScopeCreep automates RLS policy testing. Developers define expected access patterns (user A should see their own data, admin B should see everything, user C should see nothing), and ScopeCreep automatically generates test cases, runs them against your database, and alerts on violations.
target_audience: Backend developers using PostgreSQL RLS for multi-tenant applications
Security engineers auditing database access controls
Startups using Supabase who rely heavily on RLS
Development teams needing to validate access controls in CI/CD
scopecreep.mission_statement: ScopeCreep exists because database authorization is too critical to test manually. Our mission is to bring the same rigor of API security testing to row-level security.
scopecreep.success_milestone: 3 companies pilot ScopeCreep and identify at least one RLS misconfiguration they weren't aware of
scopecreep.tagline: Automated RLS testing for databases. Catch authorization bugs before they reach production.

openorbit.name: OpenOrbit
openorbit.description: OpenOrbit is a project-focused social platform for tech professionals to build, design, and learn in public. Unlike LinkedIn's resume-centric approach, OpenOrbit centers on active projects—developers, designers, security professionals, and other tech creators share their works-in-progress with status updates, images, videos, and documentation.
openorbit.problem: LinkedIn is resume-focused—your profile is about where you worked, not what you're building. Twitter/X is noisy and not structured for project updates. There's no dedicated platform for tech professionals to share their building journey in a structured way.
openorbit.solution: OpenOrbit makes 'building in public' the core social experience. Users create project profiles with milestones, get feedback from the community, find collaborators, and showcase their building process.
target_audience: Indie hackers and solo developers building in public
Designers sharing their design process and getting feedback
Security researchers documenting their work
Open-source maintainers engaging with their community
openorbit.mission_statement: OpenOrbit exists because your best work isn't a resume bullet—it's what you're building right now. Our mission is to create a social platform where tech professionals connect through active projects, not past credentials.
openorbit.success_milestone: 100 users create accounts and post at least 3 project updates each, with measurable engagement (comments/feedback) on their posts
openorbit.tagline: Build in public, together. A social platform for tech creators sharing projects, not resumes.

instapi.name: InstAPI
instapi.description: InstAPI is a rapid API prototyping tool that lets developers spin up mock REST APIs instantly for frontend development and testing. Define your endpoints and response shapes, and InstAPI generates a working API you can hit immediately—no backend code required.
instapi.problem: Frontend developers often block on backend APIs that aren't ready yet. Setting up mock servers is tedious. Existing tools like JSON Server require local setup. There's friction between needing an API to build against and waiting for the real backend to be ready.
instapi.solution: InstAPI lets you define API endpoints and response schemas in a web UI, then instantly generates a hosted mock API you can call from your frontend. No local setup, no code, just define and use.
target_audience: Frontend developers needing mock APIs for development
Full-stack developers prototyping before building real backends
Teams with frontend and backend working in parallel
Developers building demos or proof-of-concepts quickly
instapi.mission_statement: InstAPI exists to unblock frontend development. Our mission is to eliminate the wait for backend APIs by letting developers instantly create the mock APIs they need to keep building.
instapi.success_milestone: 50 developers use InstAPI to create mock APIs for their projects
instapi.tagline: Mock APIs in seconds. Stop waiting for backend, start building frontend.
